categories.name: Start Your Engines: The World of NASCAR

questions.clue: This legendary driver, often referred to as 'The Intimidator', won 7 NASCAR Cup Series championships.
In 1948, NASCAR was founded by this visionary, who also helped create the Daytona International Speedway.
This Canadian NASCAR driver, known for his poetic racing style, hails from Montreal and has competed in both the Cup and Xfinity Series.
Winning the Daytona 500 three times, this driver is celebrated for his poetic 'Rainbow Warrior' paint schemes.
This female driver made history by winning the pole position at the Daytona 500 in 2013, the first woman to do so.

categories.name: Verses Unleashed: Poets and Their Works

questions.clue: This poet's 'The Raven' is a classic of American literature known for its melancholic and gothic tone.
Known as Canada's unofficial poet laureate, he penned the famous poem 'In Flanders Fields'.
This female poet from Amherst, Massachusetts, was known for her reclusive life and posthumously published poetry.
This poet and NASCAR enthusiast penned 'Fast Cars and Freedom', exploring the intersection of speed and emotion.
This Canadian poet and singer-songwriter wrote 'The Stranger', reflecting on themes of alienation and identity.

categories.name: Oh, Canada! Exploring the Great North

questions.clue: This is the capital city of Canada, known for its Winterlude festival and beautiful Parliament Hill.
This Canadian province is home to the only NASCAR-sanctioned race track in the country, the Canadian Tire Motorsport Park.
Often called the 'Gateway to the North,' this city is the capital of the Northwest Territories.
This Canadian poet, known for works like 'The Journals of Susanna Moodie,' won the Governor General's Award for Poetry in 1970.
This Canadian bay, the world's largest inland sea, is named after an explorer who was searching for the Northwest Passage in the 17th century.

categories.name: The Art of Cartography: Maps Through the Ages

questions.clue: In the 15th century, this Italian explorer's maps helped pave the way for European exploration of the Americas.
This Canadian province known for its poets and NASCAR fans can be found on maps dating back to the early 1600s.
Named after a German cartographer, this projection is widely used for nautical purposes.
This 16th-century atlas by Abraham Ortelius is considered the first modern atlas.
This ancient Greek geographer's work, 'Geographia', influenced mapmaking for centuries.

categories.name: Pioneers of Technology: Innovators Who Changed the World

questions.clue: This Canadian engineer is known for inventing the telephone in 1876.
This innovator, often associated with Ford, revolutionized the automotive industry with the moving assembly line.
Known for poetry as well as programming, this daughter of Lord Byron is considered the first computer programmer.
This Canadian computer scientist co-invented the Java programming language at Sun Microsystems.
Before becoming a major player in electric vehicles, this entrepreneur co-founded a software company that merged with Confinity to become PayPal.

final.clue: This Canadian driver, known as the 'Man in Black', was the first to compete in the NASCAR Cup Series, debuting in the 1950s and also inspired a poem about racing dreams.
